1. Collect 5 mL of biomass at designated timepoints and fix at 4C for at least 2 hours
  + Prepare 5 mL tubes beforehand with 0.5 mL of 37% paraformaldehyde in each
  + Put in walk in fridge for at least 2 hours per sample, can be left overnight  
  + Note that this is the same procedure as biomass fixation for glycogen
  
2. Decant excess formaldehyde liquid and set aside sample for staining
  + Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 5000 rpm
  + Decant, then add 5 mL of DI to each tube
  + Resuspend pellet and aliquot 0.5 mL of mixture into an eppendorf tube
  
3. Prepare Nile Blue A staining solution - 0.02% w/v in ethanol
  
4. Add 0.5 mL staining solution to each eppendorf  

5. Stain for 3 minutes at room temperature, then dispense into plate (200 uL) and read at excitation 360 and emission 460.
